attributes.action: Declare and grant amnesty to all African and Caribbean illegal immigrants in the UK on 25th March 2007 to mark the bicentenary of Parliamentary abolition of the Trans Atlantic Slave Trade.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: On March 25th 1807, Great Britain put it’s name on the map of world history when, after a spirited campaign , parliament formally passed the bill for abolition of  slave trade. That historic event finally ended a sad chapter of British history. In the spirit of National Reconciliation and Restoration we urge the Prime Minister, as a gesture of goodwill to declare and grant amnesty to all African and Caribbean immigrants living in the UK who have no legal papers. We also ask the Prime Minister to write off all remaining debts owed by African and Caribbean nations to Great Britain. To us this will be one of the greatest ways in which Britain can mark the bicentary.
